segment.source: Markdown is generally quick and easy to author, but creating tables is a well-known challenge.
segment.target: Markdown is generally quick and easy to author, but creating tables is a well-known challenge.

segment.source: Before looking at tooling to help create tables, it's worth knowing how to author them natively in GitHub-flavored markdown ("strict" markdown does not provide any table support, but GitHub does support them):
segment.target: Before looking at tooling to help create tables, it's worth knowing how to author them natively in GitHub-flavored markdown ("strict" markdown does not provide any table support, but GitHub does support them):

segment.source: There are some web-based tools that will allow you build your table online and then copy and paste the resulting markdown into your editor.
segment.target: There are some web-based tools that will allow you build your table online and then copy and paste the resulting markdown into your editor.

segment.source: Markdown Tables Generator -- It can also general tables in HTML and LaTeX
segment.target: Markdown Tables Generator -- It can also general tables in HTML and LaTeX

segment.source: Different markdown editors handle tables with different levels of sophistication.
segment.target: Different markdown editors handle tables with different levels of sophistication.

segment.source: MarkdownPad Pro has very good table support, but you'll need to pay have the $15 Pro version for GitHub-flavored markdown support.
segment.target: MarkdownPad Pro has very good table support, but you'll need to pay have the $15 Pro version for GitHub-flavored markdown support.

segment.source: Atom has an add-in package called markdown-table-formatter that lets you create a table via GUI.
segment.target: Atom has an add-in package called markdown-table-formatter that lets you create a table via GUI.
